name: The Archivist's Creed
description: The true strength of a civilization is not measured by its weapons or its armies, but by the knowledge it preserves for future generations. — Archivist's Creed, Circa 3412 A.G.

name: The Stars Remember
description: Even when empires fall and data is lost, the stars hold memory in their silence.

name: Fracture of Elysiar
description: A high-energy experiment gone wrong tore the planet of Elysiar into four semi-sentient floating continents, each orbiting the event core independently. This marked the start of the Psionic Age.

name: The Veil Codex
description: An ancient tome written in living script that alters its message with each reading. Believed to be a remnant of Pre-Void Civilizations.

name: Virella
description: A twilight world with no sun, kept warm by its molten core. Its surface is home to the Cradle Archives—vast underground vaults sealed in obsidian and watched by sentient flame-beetles.

name: The Keepers of the First Light
description: A secretive guild of stellar monks preserving the philosophies of pre-Galactic civilizations. They refuse all digital transmission, recording only in crystal memory cores.

name: Treaty of Null
description: A multi-system agreement to ban time-manipulation technologies after the Echo Collapse distorted four major timelines. The treaty is enforced by the Temporal Inquisition.

name: Record or Regret
description: For every piece of knowledge we fail to preserve, a generation will be condemned to rediscover it in fire.

name: Oracle Core
description: A quantum artifact that predicts branching outcomes of interstellar events. It speaks only in riddles and statistical contradictions.

name: Solstice Prime
description: A rogue planet in deep drift, cloaked in a perpetual aurora. Said to be the birthplace of dream-transference technology and the final resting place of the Dreamer Kings.
